content:
SeaWorld Orlando offers several behind-the-scenes tours and special experiences that provide a more in-depth look at the park's marine life and conservation efforts. Here are a few options:

1. **Behind the Scenes Tour**: This 90-minute guided tour takes you behind the scenes of SeaWorld's animal habitats, including the dolphin and sea lion areas. You'll learn about the park's animal care programs, feeding procedures, and conservation efforts. ($59 per person, ages 10+)
2. **Dolphin Encounter Tour**: Get up close and personal with SeaWorld's bottlenose dolphins in this interactive tour. You'll learn about dolphin behavior, training, and conservation, and even get to touch and feed them. ($99 per person, ages 10+)
3. **Sea Lion Point Tour**: Explore the sea lion habitat and learn about these charismatic creatures' natural behaviors, habitat, and conservation status. You'll also get to feed and interact with the sea lions. ($49 per person, ages 10+)
4. **Shamu Stadium Tour**: Go behind the scenes of the iconic Shamu show and learn about the orca whales, their behavior, and the trainers' techniques. You'll also get to see the whales up close and participate in a training session. ($79 per person, ages 10+)
5. **Wild Arctic Interaction Program**: This 60-minute experience lets you interact with polar bears, walruses, and seals in a simulated Arctic environment. You'll learn about these animals' habitats, behavior, and conservation status. ($129 per person, ages 10+)
6. **SeaWorld Cares Tour**: This 2-hour tour focuses on SeaWorld's conservation efforts, animal rescue and rehabilitation programs, and veterinary care. You'll visit the park's animal hospital and learn about the park's commitment to conservation. ($99 per person, ages 10+)
7. **Animal Interactions**: SeaWorld offers various animal interactions throughout the day, such as dolphin, sea lion, and penguin encounters. These interactions are usually 15-30 minutes long and provide a more personalized experience with the animals. (Prices vary, ages 10+)

These behind-the-scenes tours and special experiences offer a unique perspective on SeaWorld's marine life and conservation efforts. Be sure to book in advance, as spaces are limited and popular tours may sell out quickly.

Remember to also explore the park's various animal exhibits, shows, and interactive experiences, which are included with general admission. These provide a great way to learn about the marine animals and SeaWorld's conservation efforts throughout the day.
